intro: Galium vernum, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually oval to lance-shaped. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom in early spring. Galium vernum is often found in woodland areas, meadows, and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
